# SCAR Antarctic Digital Database (ADD) Metadata Toolbox - Adding new records

Follow this workflow to create and publish new records.

**Note:** You will need *author* rights to import new metadata records and *editor* rights to publish them for others
to see.

## Overview

This sequence diagram shows how the overall process to add and view a new record/item:

[![](https://mermaid.-PkM6IFB1Ymxpc2ggcmVjb3JkXG4gIFUtPj5DOiBSZWNvcmQgcmV0cmlldmVkXG4gIEMtPj5QOiBSZWNvcmQgaW5zZXJ0ZWRcbiAgQS0-PkM6IEJ1aWxkIGl0ZW0gcGFnZXNcbiAgUC0-PkM6IFJlY29yZHMgcmV0cmlldmVkXG4gIEEtPj5DOiBCdWlsZCByZWNvcmQgcGFnZXNcbiAgUC0-)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#-PkM6IFB1Ymxpc2ggcmVjb3JkXG4gIFUtPj5DOiBSZWNvcmQgcmV0cmlldmVkXG4gIEMtPj5QOiBSZWNvcmQgaW5zZXJ0ZWRcbiAgQS0-PkM6IEJ1aWxkIGl0ZW0gcGFnZXNcbiAgUC0-PkM6IFJlY29yZHMgcmV0cmlldmVkXG4gIEEtPj5DOiBCdWlsZCByZWNvcmQgcGFnZXNcbiAgUC0-)

1. the user signs-into the metadata editor
2. a JSON file defining the record is imported into the metadata editor
3. the metadata editor inserts the imported record into the unpublished repository
4. the imported record is published
5. the metadata editor retrieves the imported record from the unpublished repository
6. the metadata editor inserts the imported record into the published repository
7. records are built as items as static HTML pages
8. records are retrieved from the published repository
9. records are built as styled XML files
10. records are retrieved from the published repository
11. static HTML pages and XML files are published to the static site
12. visitors can access the new record and item page through the static site

## Steps

1. run [`auth sign-in`](command-reference.md#auth-sign-in)
1. run [`record import --publish`](command-reference.md#collections-import)
2. run [`site build-items`](command-reference.md#site-build-collections)
3. run [`site build-records`](command-reference.md#site-build-collections)
3. run [`site publish`](command-reference.md#site-publish)
